Slopes, Contrasts and Pairwise Comparisons"

Daniel Lüdecke

2023-02-17

Source: vignettes/introduction_comparisons.Rmd
introduction_comparisons.Rmd

Aim of the ggeffects-package 

library(ggeffects)
library(ggplot2)
library(parameters)

data(efc)
# make educational status categorical
efc$c172code <- as.factor(efc$c172code)
levels(efc$c172code) <- c("low", "mid", "hi")
# make gender categorical
efc$c161sex <- as.factor(efc$c161sex)
levels(efc$c161sex) <- c("male", "female")

model <- lm(barthtot ~ c12hour + neg_c_7 + c161sex + c172code, data = efc)
model_parameters(model)
#> Parameter        | Coefficient |   SE |          95% CI | t(809) |      p
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------------
#> (Intercept)      |       99.82 | 3.41 | [93.14, 106.50] |  29.31 | < .001
#> c12hour          |       -0.25 | 0.02 | [-0.29,  -0.22] | -14.60 | < .001
#> neg c 7          |       -2.28 | 0.23 | [-2.72,  -1.84] | -10.12 | < .001
#> c161sex [female] |        0.87 | 1.99 | [-3.03,   4.78] |   0.44 | 0.660 
#> c172code [mid]   |        2.88 | 2.12 | [-1.28,   7.05] |   1.36 | 0.175 
#> c172code [hi]    |        1.22 | 2.70 | [-4.08,   6.51] |   0.45 | 0.652
mydf <- ggpredict(model, terms = "c12hour")
mydf
#> # Predicted values of Total score BARTHEL INDEX
#> 
#> c12hour | Predicted |         95% CI
#> ------------------------------------
#>       0 |     72.81 | [67.91, 77.71]
#>      20 |     67.75 | [63.02, 72.48]
#>      45 |     61.42 | [56.77, 66.06]
#>      65 |     56.35 | [51.66, 61.04]
#>      85 |     51.29 | [46.46, 56.12]
#>     105 |     46.22 | [41.17, 51.28]
#>     125 |     41.16 | [35.80, 46.52]
#>     170 |     29.76 | [23.49, 36.04]
#> 
#> Adjusted for:
#> *  neg_c_7 = 11.84
#> *  c161sex =  male
#> * c172code =   low

theme_set(theme_bw())
ggplot(mydf, aes(x, predicted)) +
  geom_line()

# automatic detection of numeric focal variable
# calculating p-value for linear trend 
hypothesis_test(model, "c12hour")
#> # Linear trend for c12hour
#> 
#> Slope |         95% CI |      p
#> -------------------------------
#> -0.25 | [-0.29, -0.22] | < .001
